intro: Critoniopsis duncanii, commonly known as Duncan's corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested habitats and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It is known for its medicinal properties in traditional Chinese medicine. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
